intro: Fagarastrum thunbergii, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade. Fagarastrum thunbergii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance once established.
